turns.content: what is the name of (glutine) the polymer created by mixing baking soda and superglue?

The name of the polymer created by mixing baking soda and superglue is not known as "glutine". Mixing baking soda and super glue will not create a polymer. Super glue, also known as cyanoacrylate, is a type of adhesive that forms a strong bond when it comes into contact with moisture. Baking soda, on the other hand, is a type of alkali that is often used as a rising agent in baking. Mixing the two substances together will not create a polymer, it will only create a paste that will not have any particular use.
